meanings.definition: To disconnect a spacecraft or computer from a docking station.
meanings.sent1: The astronaut will undock the spaceship before heading back to Earth.
meanings.sent2: The crew prepared to undock the spacecraft after completing their mission.
meanings.sent3: As the spaceship undocked, the crew waved goodbye to the space station.
meanings.sent4: The decision to undock the satellite from the docking station was made swiftly.
meanings.sent5: The undocking process requires careful coordination to ensure a safe separation.

meanings.definition: The act of separating a boat or ship from a dock.
meanings.sent1: The undocking of the ship was smooth and efficient.
meanings.sent2: After the undocking, the boat sailed away into the open sea.
meanings.sent3: The undocking of the yacht caused a small ripple in the calm waters.
meanings.sent4: Witnessing the undocking of the massive cruise ship was a memorable experience.
meanings.sent5: The undocking of the sailboat marked the beginning of a new voyage.

meanings.definition: To remove a device or object from a docking station.
meanings.sent1: Please undock the tablet carefully to avoid any damage.
meanings.sent2: The technician undocked the external hard drive from the computer.
meanings.sent3: Forgetting to undock the phone before leaving caused a minor inconvenience.
meanings.sent4: The robot efficiently undocked the tool from the charging station.
meanings.sent5: Undocking the camera from the tripod allows for more flexibility in photography.
